revised_title: In Memoriam: Celebrating the Lives and Contributions of Fellows of the Royal Society
tldr: This article is an obituary address by Prof. C. S. Sherrington, the President of the Royal Society, at the Anniversary Meeting in 1921. It commemorates the lives and scientific contributions of fifteen Fellows and one Foreign Member of the Society who passed away since the last Anniversary Meeting. The article highlights their significant work and achievements in various fields of science, including physics, chemistry, biology, and geology.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
